question.text: The correct function of hormones of gastrointestinal tract is

options.text: gastrin is inhibitory to the gastric glands but excitatory to the gall bladder.
secretin is excitatory to pancreas but is inhibitory to the gastric glands.
cholecystokinin is excitatory to the gall bladder but is inhibitory to the pancreas.
pancreozymins is excitatory to the pancreas but is inhibitory to the gall bladder.

solution.text:
Gastrin is secreted by stomach and acts on the stomach. It stimulates the gastric gland to release gastric juice.

Secretin is secreted by duodenum and acts on the pancreas, liver, and stomach. It is excitatory to pancrease but is inhibitory to the gastric glands.

CCK (Cholecystokinin) is also known as pancreozymins and is secreted from small intestine and cause the release of digestive enzymes and bile from the pancreas and gallbladder, respectively.
